verses.text: He who tends a fig tree will eat its fruit, and he who looks after his master will be honored.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 27:18
rsbNotes.text: 27:18 Diligent work and honest service are rewarded (22:29).

verses.text: As water reflects a face, so a man's heart reflects the man.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 27:19
rsbNotes.text: 27:19 Just as water reflects our outward appearance, so the thoughts of our “hearts” reveal our inner nature and character.

verses.text: Death and Destruction are never satisfied, and neither are the eyes of man.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 27:20
rsbNotes.text: 27:20 Sheol and Abaddon. See notes 15:11. The parallel with destruction implies that the insatiability of the eyes involves endless desires that become destructive.
